required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PET/CT Evaluation of Primary and Metastatic Brain Tumors With a Novel Radioiodinated Phospholipid Ether Analogue I-NM404
clinical_study.official_title: PET/CT Evaluation of Primary and Metastatic Brain Tumors With a Novel Radioiodinated Phospholipid Ether Analogue I-NM404

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate diagnostic imaging techniques using 124I-NM404 PET/CT in human brain tumors. This goal will be accomplished by quantifying tumor uptake and determining the optimal PET/CT protocol, comparing PET tumor uptake to MRI, and calculating tumor dosimetry. The long-term goals of this research are to improve the diagnosis and treatment of malignant brain tumors by using radioiodinated NM404

primary_outcome.measure: Tumor to Background Ratios (TBR) Post-imaging for All Lesions With PET Uptake
primary_outcome.description: TBR is calculated by using tumor/lesion SUVmax and dividing by contralateral normal brain background SUVmean value. Imaging performed at 24- and 48 hours post injection.

primary_outcome.measure: Tumor to Background Ratios (TBR) Post-imaging for Confirmed Malignant Tumors
primary_outcome.description: TBR is calculated by using tumor/lesion SUVmax and dividing by contralateral normal brain background SUVmean value. Imaging performed at 24-, and 48 hours post injection.

primary_outcome.measure: Tumor to Blood Pool Ratios Post-imaging for All Lesions With PET Uptake
primary_outcome.description: Tumor to blood pool ratio (tumor SUVmax to superior sinus SUVmean) was calculated at each time point. Tumor to blood pool is calculated by using tumor/lesion SUVmax and dividing by blood pool SUVmean from placing a region of interest in the posterior sagittal sinus near the confluence of sinuses. Imaging performed at 24- and 48 hours post injection.

primary_outcome.measure: Tumor to Blood Pool Ratios Post-imaging for Confirmed Malignant Tumors
primary_outcome.description: Tumor to blood pool ratio (tumor SUVmax to superior sinus SUVmean) was calculated at each time point. Tumor to blood pool is calculated by using tumor/lesion SUVmax and dividing by blood pool SUVmean from placing a region of interest in the posterior sagittal sinus near the confluence of sinuses. Imaging performed at 24-, and 48 hours post injection.

arm_group.arm_group_label: I124-NM404 brain metastases or GBM imaging

intervention.description: injection of 5.0mCi I-124 NM404 Arms: I124-NM404 brain metastases or GBM imaging Other Names: PET imaging with I-124 NM404
intervention.arm_group_label: I124-NM404 brain metastases or GBM imaging

intervention.description: injection of an experimental imaging agent, 5mCi I-124NM404
intervention.arm_group_label: I124-NM404 brain metastases or GBM imaging

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants will have a contrast enhanced brain MRI which documents evidence of primary or metastatic brain tumor or suspected tumor recurrence after therapy
- Tumor size at least 1.5 cm in greatest axial dimension on MRI. MRI must be obtained within 2 months of study inclusion
- Adult patients 18 or older
- Female patients must not be pregnant or breast feeding and both women of childbearing potential, and men, must use appropriate means of contraception and must be maintained for at least 45 days after injection of 124I-NM404 Participants must not attempt to become pregnant during this time
- Platelet count must be ≥ 160,000/µl, Hematocrit must be ≥ 22%, Leukocyte count must be ≥ 3,000/µL, Creatinine must be ≤ 2.5 mg/dL, ALT must be ≤ 130 U/L, AST must be ≤ 100 U/L, and urine or serum pregnancy test must be negative for pregnancy
- Patient provides informed consent
- Karnofsky score ≥ 60
- For previously treated brain tumors, targeted brain therapy (radiation or drug) must have concluded ≥2 months prior to injection of 124I-NM404
Exclusion Criteria:
- Life expectancy of < 3 months
- Allergy to potassium iodide (SSKI or Thyroshield)
- Unwilling or unable to complete 3 separate PET/CT imaging sessions of 90 minutes each over 3 days
- Pregnancy or breast-feeding during time of study and/or anticipated breast feeding at any time for 45 days after injection of 124I-NM404.

facility.name: University of Wisconsin Hospital and Clinics

link.description: Alkylphospohocholine Analogs for Broad-Spectrum Cancer Imaging and Therapy
Impact of PET and MRI threshold-based tumor volume segmentation on patient-specific
PET/CT imaging of the diapeutic alkylphosphocholine analog 124I-CLR1404 in high and low-grade brain tumors

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were enrolled from March 2012 to September 2014 at the University of Wisconsin Hospital and Clinics.

group.title: I124-NM404 Brain Metastases or GBM Imaging
group.description: Participants injected with 185 MBq ± of 124I-CLR1404 intravenously over a period of 1 to 2 minutes, followed by a flush of 10 mL of normal saline. Subjects returned for PET/CT imaging at 6-, 24-, and 48-hours post-injection. Participants received 3 drops of potassium iodide by mouth (1 gm/ml) 1 to 24 hours prior to injection of 124I-CLR1404 and continued additional daily doses prior to each PET/CT scan for 3 consecutive days.

group.title: I124-NM404 Brain Metastases or GBM Imaging

outcome.title: Tumor to Background Ratios (TBR) Post-imaging for All Lesions With PET Uptake
outcome.description: TBR is calculated by using tumor/lesion SUVmax and dividing by contralateral normal brain background SUVmean value. Imaging performed at 24- and 48 hours post injection.
outcome.population: Of 12 subjects, only 8 had evaluable data.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data were collected for up to 48 hours (until the time of the final scan).
reported_events.desc: Subjects are monitored for adverse events (AEs) by the research team and reported by the principle investigator or co-investigators. Subjects are observed during the injection of 124I-NM404 and for 30 minutes after injection. Subjects are also monitored at each PET/CT scanning session. Approximately 2 – 4 weeks after injection of 124I-NM404, subjects were contacted by phone or other means and/or medical records were reviewed, if available, to assess for any AEs. AE data collection is complete.

group.title: I124-NM404 Brain Metastases or GBM Imaging

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
